The lips are in neutral position as they stand while we breaththrough the mouth.

The mouth: the distance between the upper and lower incisors is about8 mm.

The tongue: the tip of the tongue is pulled down behind the lowerincisors and a bit pulled backwards. The root of the tongue makespartition to soft palate by lifting. So the tongue moves backwards andwith its back part together with soft palate which is lifted make apartition which breaks off. Then implosion appears in the mouth.

Soft palate is lifted and closes the passage for the airstream to thenasal cavity.

Vocal chords are quiet - the sound is unvoiced.

Expiration is strong and when the occlusion stops, the explosion isheard.

Concentrates of the acoustic energy are the same as with the sound G.
